item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Music is the universal language of mankind." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "Is it always to be a winners-losers world, or can we keep everyone in the game? Do we still have what it takes to find a better way?" -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "The heart will turn to a prune if love is always by the numbers. How will you know if someone really loves you if they only meet your expectations and not your needs?" -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "Above all, if what you've done is stupid, but it works, it ain't stupid." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "And the night shall be filled with music, And the cares, that infest the day, Shall fold their tents like the Arabs, and silently steal away." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Robert Harling
item.description: "smile, It increases your face value" -- Robert Harling

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "A man can't soar too high, when he flies with his own wings." -- William Blake

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by William Congreve
item.description: "Heav'n hath no Rage, like Love to Hatred turn'd, Nor Hell a Fury, like a Woman scorn'd." -- William Congreve

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "Never, ever regret or apologize for believing that when one man or one woman decides to risk addressing the world with truth, the world may stop what it is doing and hear. There is too much evidence to the contrary." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "It is the chair in honor of all those who, however competently, embrace the impossible. Sit in that chair someday." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "If you tell people you talk to God, they'll think you're religious, but if you say God talks to you, it's ten to one they'll think you're crazy." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "No wonder men got impervious to superficial pain, I thought. It came from this habit of hammering each other incessantly." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Walter's eyes were very wonderful. All the joy and sorrow and laughter and loyalty and aspirations of many generations lying under the sod looked out of their dark-gray depths." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "Women need to feel loved and men need to feel needed." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "Loving's pretty easy. It's letting someone love you that's hard." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Philosophers have argued for centuries about how many angels can dance on the head of a pin, but materialists have known all along that it depends on whether they are jitterbugging or dancing cheek to cheek." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "The stronger a woman gets, the more insecure the men in her life feel. It doesn’t work that way for a woman. We celebrate strength--in our partners as well as in ourselves." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "[She] had felt straight away that she wasn’t meeting a new friend, but recognizing an old one." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "She knew this music--knew it down to the very core of her being--but she had never heard it before. Unfamiliar, it had still always been there inside her, waiting to be woken. It grew from the core of mystery that gives a secret its special delight, religion its awe. It demanded to be accepted by simple faith, not dissected or questioned, and at the same time, it begged to be doubted and probed." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "I love this world," he added. "That is what rules my life. When I die, I want to have done all in my power to leave it in a better state than it was when I found it. At the same time I know that this can never be. The world has grown so complex that one voice can do little to alter it any longer. That doesn't stop me from doing what I can, but it makes the task hard. The successes are so small, the failures so large and many. It's like trying to stem a storm with one's bare hands." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It was in the spring that Josephine and I had first loved each other, or, at least, had first come into the full knowledge that we loved. I think that we must have loved each other all our lives, and that each succeeding spring was a word in the revelation of that love, not to be understood until, in the fullness of time, the whole sentence was written out in that most beautiful of all beautiful springs." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Deepak Chopra
JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Deepak Chopra
item.description: "I was very afraid at the beginning, until Master told me that pain isn't the truth; it's what you have to get through in order to find the truth." -- Deepak Chopra

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Sean Stewart
item.description: "The world is a giant eye, staring back at the stars. When it tires, it closes its lids--just as I am doing now--and gives way to dreams, which is why the night is so much more mysterious than the day." -- Sean Stewart

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The inner voice is something which cannot be described in words. But sometimes we have a positive feeling that something in us prompts us to do a certain thing. The time when I learnt to recognise this voice was, I may say, the time when I started praying regularly." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Love is the strongest force the world possesses and yet it is the humblest imaginable." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: JG (The Introverted Reader) add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next." -- Dean Koontz
